Indexing improves the speed of data retrieval. Indexes are special lookup tables that the database search engine uses to speed up data access.

There are different types of indexes, like single-column indexes, composite indexes, and unique indexes. B-Trees and Hash Indexes are common underlying structures.

To ensure data safety, DBMSs offer backup and recovery mechanisms. Backups can be full, incremental, or differential. Recovery techniques, such as write-ahead logging and checkpoints, allow databases to restore to a consistent state in case of crashes or failures.
